Police are arresting the victims and injured. These victims may be charged with rioting and other serious crimes that carry significant prison sentences and hefty fines.

Economic ostracism is being used to maximum effect.

We, the protestors, will only retaliate after a series of warnings. We do not initiate the attacks, but only to protect ourselves because we all know that the police will let the attacker walk away without pressing any charges or investigation.

眾所周知淋病係想將個波比番我地，再放大暴力事件。
簡單d來講，我地文宣一直講警暴，一直講五大訴求，差d乜？ 就係無將個波比番佢呀！與其成日係度話咩唔做得唔做得，不如積極 d 將所有野推番比政府？ 聽日我要見到：

。連農牆大大隻字寫住，政府管治不力，扮對話，無真正聽市民同市威者訴求，搞到而家咁！
。等車等巴士要大大聲講，政府乜都唔做、正係識龜縮，唔肯正視問題！
。同身邊既人，無論黃藍又好，大大力屌政府無能！

獅鳥好暴力？裝飾好暴力？咪玩啦，你唔成日提，屌番政府咪無人覺得重要囉！

Police are also doing nothing to investigate or arrest suspects who have attacked others.
As a result, HK people are required to act in self-defence and deterrence against violence.

Throughout the months of protest in Hong Kong, a pattern had emerged during the numerous armed attacks on the protesters by the pro-Beijing individuals or gangs: the police would often arrest the pro-democratic victims while ignoring the pro-Beijing attackers.

As the trust in the police system continued to deteriorate, many protesters started to take the matters into their own hands. Attacks on protesters are now often repaid with equally violent measures on the spot.
